channel.title: Projectile motion graphing
channel.description:
I'm supposed to make something for physics that lets you pick an angle and projects a circle at that angle. i.e.
[img]http://img528.imageshack.us/img528/9393/projectileje0.png[/img]
Although, the formula I'm using seems to be fucked. I'll just attach the zip file to this post so you can see the problem... anyways, if you have any experience in the ways of physics & Java, I'd appreciate some help. Thanks :)

item.title: Projectile motion graphing

item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I don’t think so…i only made changes to the mouseMoved and mouseClicked methods. The reason most of the clicks didn’t show up on the panel was an issue with the formula, not the actual paint method

@White_Castle wrote:

Hah, thanks! Was there something wrong with how I was painting it on the panel as well? That’s what I thought the problem was late last night but I was too sleep-addled last night to actually figure it out.

item.title: Projectile motion graphing
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well first, when using a foreach loop with generics, you don’t need to use an Object as the iterating object and then cast it…

Second, I think you messed up the formula a bit…or implementing the formula into the panel (which gets irritating, i know). Anyway, I cleaned it up a bit for you, changed the formula a bit too that what you had. I dunno how you got the initial x and y velocities tbh, but this should work. Also, the initial combined velocity depends on the mouse location in my version too

Oh, and -9.8 m/s^2 is acceleration due to gravity, not the acceleration of the ball.

package king;

import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.Graphics;
import java.awt.Graphics2D;
import java.awt.Image;
import java.awt.Panel;
import java.awt.Point;
import java.awt.RenderingHints;
import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;
import java.awt.event.MouseListener;
import java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class MotionPanel extends Panel implements MouseListener, MouseMotionListener {
    private static final double ACC_GRAVITY = 9.8;
	private static final int STARTX = 10, STARTY = 490;
	
	private ArrayList<Point> points = new ArrayList<Point>();
	private double theta;
	private int relativeX = 110, relativeY = 390;
	private int calculationX, calculationY;
	private boolean isRunning = false;
	
	
	public MotionPanel() {
		setPreferredSize(new Dimension(500, 500));
		addMouseListener(this);
		addMouseMotionListener(this);
	}
	
	public void update(Graphics g) {
		paint(g);
	}

	public void paint(Graphics g) {
		Image offscreen = createImage(getWidth(), getHeight());
		Graphics2D buffer = (Graphics2D)offscreen.getGraphics();
		buffer.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON);
		
		buffer.setColor(Color.RED);
		buffer.drawLine(relativeX, STARTY, relativeX, relativeY);
		buffer.drawLine(STARTX, STARTY, relativeX, STARTY);
		
		buffer.setColor(Color.BLACK);
		buffer.drawString("X: " + calculationX, 10, 10);
		buffer.drawString("Y: " + calculationY, 10, 20);
		buffer.drawString(Math.round(theta) + "º", STARTX + 20, STARTY - 5);
		
		buffer.drawLine(STARTX, STARTY, relativeX, relativeY);
		for(Point p : points)
			buffer.fillOval(p.x - 5, p.y - 5, 10, 10);
		
		g.drawImage(offscreen, 0, 0, this);
	}

	public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent me) {
		if(isRunning)
			return;
		
		new Thread(new Runnable() {
			public void run() {
				int time = 0;
				points.clear();
				isRunning = true;
				
				final double vi = Math.hypot(calculationX, calculationY) / 5;
				final double vxi = vi * Math.cos(Math.toRadians(theta));
				final double vyi = vi * Math.sin(Math.toRadians(theta));
				System.out.println(vxi +"::"+ vyi);
				double x = 0D, y = 0D;
				
				while(x < 500 && y < 500 && x >= 0 && y >= 0) {
				    x = vxi * time;
				    y = (vyi * time) - (0.5D * ACC_GRAVITY * Math.pow(time, 2));
				    
					System.out.println(time + ": " + x + ", " + y);
					points.add(new Point((int)Math.round(x) + STARTX, STARTY - (int)Math.round(y)));
					repaint();
					
					try {
						Thread.sleep(250);
					} catch(InterruptedException e) { }
					time++;
				}
				
				repaint();
				isRunning = false;
			}
		}).start();
	}

	public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent me) {}
	public void mouseExited(MouseEvent me) {}
	public void mousePressed(MouseEvent me) {}
	public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent me) {}
	public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent me) {
		mouseMoved(me);
	}

	public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent me) {
		relativeX = me.getX();
		relativeY = me.getY();
		
		calculationX = relativeX - STARTX;
		calculationY = STARTY - relativeY;
		
		if(calculationX < 0 || calculationY < 0)
		    theta = 0;
		else
		    theta = Math.abs(Math.toDegrees(Math.atan2(calculationY, calculationX)));
		repaint();
	}
}

Read full topic

item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Yeah, it’s supposed to project using “free-fall”, meaning that there’s no air resistance. The rate of acceleration is -9.8m/s/s.
